definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: He safely negotiated the slippery stepping-stones.
sentences.chinese: 他安全地走过了打滑的石阶。

sentences.english: The boys went up and down the stone steps.
sentences.chinese: 那些男孩在那段石阶上走上走下。

sentences.english: I like walking on the stone steps beside the lake, looking at the swimming goldfish.
sentences.chinese: 喜欢走在湖边的石阶上，看着里面的金鱼游来游去。

sentences.english: The only sound was the soft scruff of their feet upon the steps.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的声响便是他们的脚叩在石阶上的声音。

sentences.english: The famous stairs are now covered with graffiti.
sentences.chinese: 这道著名的石阶现在已被画满了涂鸦。

sentences.english: A 2500-step stone road was built in ancient times.
sentences.chinese: 在古代建了一条2500级石阶路。

sentences.english: The upper story is reached by rough stone stairs.
sentences.chinese: 崎岖的石阶可通到楼上。

sentences.english: The stone steps have worn smooth.
The metal dish clattered down the stone stairs.
sentences.chinese: 金属盘子叮叮咚咚滚下了石阶。

sentences.english: On 12 class stone stairses, it is each to carve form absolute being fierce very of stone statue.
sentences.chinese: 十二级石阶上，每一级都雕塑着一座形神凶煞的石像。

sentences.english: Its gate was left unlatched, so I pushed it open.
sentences.chinese: 经人指引，我登上石阶，推开虚掩的门扉。

sentences.english: I watched him sit on a step to tighten the laces on his dress shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我看着他坐在石阶上，系紧礼服鞋的鞋带。

sentences.english: During the night a metal dish was heard to clatter down the stone stairs.
sentences.chinese: 夜里听到有金属盘子叮叮咚咚滚下了石阶的声音。

sentences.english: Through the Jinshui Bridge, and along the steps of, is the dragon and tiger Dian.
sentences.chinese: 穿过金水桥，沿石阶而上，便是龙虎殿。

sentences.english: Dust swirled on the broad stairway.
sentences.chinese: 宽阔的石阶上尘土飞扬。

definition: to walk slowly up a flight of steps (idiom)
road or pavement laid with flagstones
winding corridor/cloister/ambulatory (covered walkway around a cloister)
flight of steps/(fig.) a means of advancement/stepping stone
halfway up a mountain/lit. waist of mountain
